content: I suggest making it more clear in text that the 3x3 square is only for the target, not the attacker. Currently the text is very ambiguous on that point.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Definitely on the trickier side when you account for having to convert square names to coordinates but definitely doable for a clash.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Had fun with it, it was nice !
The logic of what to do isn't hard, and is well explained, but as someone who doesn't play chess it took me a little bit more time than i care to admit to get the coordinates right ^^" 
A bit confusing for a coder not familiar with chess positions, we are pretty hardwired to have rows number 0/1 at the top and the bigger the number,  the lower the row. But in the case of chess positions, line 8 is at the top and line 1 at the bottom :')

So for me a bit unnatural but nowhere near a hard difficulty. Once you get used to it you have multiple ways to deal with it pretty neatly.
Overall, great job, was easy enough to grasp, not too difficult and with a twist in the array management that made it interesting !

I instantly upvoted it and waited a bit to be sure I wanted to approve because it took me more than five minutes, but I do like clashes than can be a little longer, and it's definitely solvable in less than 5 :)

Solved in C++

Well done, this is a good challenge.

While trying to optimize my solution I realized that in none of the test cases the explosion would propagate out-of-bounds. ü§î

Knowing that, even though it took me way more time than a clash, I got down to 214 chars üòä

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash. I do play Atomic Chess some times.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

Goal section
* Please format "." as a {{constant}} (in the 4th paragraph).

Cases
* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the target and one or more surrounding pieces (and maybe even the attacker too if that's valid within the rules) are all pawns.

(Please do not modify the current cases directly as they have good coverage of the different scenarios by themselves.)

Thanks.
You duplicated your submission somehow. Here's the other one: https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/7122933a227ea9107c00ef42016ca532a67a4.

Some code I wrote to generate random chess positions (not checked for legality other than valid piece counts, both kings on the board and pawns on legal ranks). In case anyone else would find it useful.

https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=pVK7btwwEARS6isWdArJoXiSC1sOEF8RIE0a9wQhkDqdjw6PlEkKFv36kTQunJ_K12Sl8wHpTYDE7mB3Zhbc329-VOn19c8Yt2Xz91NzAt93fQignPQbuOlt72V0HnLrIkTnwLgb3UlDYe9CNAm8tBu3h8EFHbWzoch-eNnNIXyDip1n1_LezhCmZ6yCFTSZwpiw95N9LCAsDEbH_POqyMzMe_dLKWu9J_AFyEDgFPIGn6ONgkXX6szoELE6N1hl2Dh0MvQF63bSBxZ243Zrehacj61Kj23NVz9XWsAayhq-QvXMK4qtLOiHHqnP8B6HPtCDyE7gXnoLs84MhUWRPegh56dE4vRkRwQbvNuMXZyxesYaIoqjfsH2cnh80hSm9AQThYSGp7SgbX21vlxDWzOH31TC5QX6wmwRL6GGZzRwcMD5RJOgL4lqOiWq2K3TVhw8ASj-kgSfBFJrbFK8EhTBsp4R_l8qFt1Fw-fkeiCUMFJgyzBGXJfDAr3v0XGf_gE
Thanks. It's because I started it as a WIP and didn't realise it would split when I turned it to 'Ready'. Deleted the WIP now.

That's a good point though, I probably should add a test/validator pair where the explosion occurs along an edge or corner.

Will get onto it now.

Edit: Done. Corner tests are now active.

Thanks for the feedback, upvote and approval! :)

It is a pity about the chess coordinates being so different to what we're used to in coding. I could rotate the board to the 'black' side, but then h1 would be the top-left corner and the columns would be backwards "hgfedcba", so either way something is 'backwards'.

I'm glad you were able to get past that and solve it. I was tempted at one point to just use (0,0) style coordinates, but I think using chess notation makes it more interesting.

Oh, I hadn't thought of it that way.

The attacker and the attacked piece are always on the same square once you attack, but I have added " (of the [[target]]'s co-ordinates)" to make it clear that it's not the attacker's original square that explodes.

Thanks! The ambiguity came in part from the fact that it's never explained what "attack" means: in regular chess, some people often say "capture" when actually moving and capturing, and "attack" when only "threatening from a distance without moving"; ie, "the bishop is attacking the queen" only means that the bishop has a direct line of sight to the queen, not that it's actually capturing the queen right now.

That's a good point, I see now I even used 'capture' in the constraints. I think 'capture' is a bit less concrete of a concept in atomic chess since you can 'capture' a lot of pieces in one move, and they are implied to be killed rather than captured :P.

Thanks for the feedback, I've edited the constraints to be more consistent too now.

It really does, at first i thought about suggesting changing the coordinates but that's IMO the funniest part of this clash, so don't do it :D
There are plenty of way to deal with it in C++, i used strings {8...1} and {a...h} to search into to get the right indexes, but you could also reverse the lines so line 8 becomes 0, or use a 1d array with modulos etc etc...
Only real problem for me is that this clash in reverse would be pretty hard. But in shortest this one is going to be extra fun !
Yeah, I didn't enable Reverse. I don't think it's fair to expect people to know chess coordinates let alone to guess the rules of the explosions. Fastest and Shortest only. :)

That's perfect. 
All 4 cases covered.
Upvoted once more üëç
